title: Samia Suluhu Hassan
added: She now takes over from Magufuli who was a dictator. Magufuli rigged the last general election and tried many attempts to assissinate his rival Tundu Lisu.
We wish President Samia all the best, please don't be a dictator like Magufuli

title: Samia Suluhu Hassan
added: After Magulfi's death on 17th March 2021, Hassan became the 6th President of Tanzania, and the country's first female president. <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-56437852}}</ref>

title: Samia Suluhu Hassan
added: After Magulfi's death on17March 2021, Hassan became the 6th President of Tanzania, and the country's first female president. <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-56437852|title=John Magufuli: Tanzania's president dies aged 61 after health rumours |date=17 March 2021 |work=BBC News}}</ref>

title: Samia Suluhu Hassan
added: AfterMagufuli's death on 17 March 2021, Hassan became the 6th President of Tanzania, and the country's first female president. <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-56437852 |title=John Magufuli: Tanzania's president dies aged 61 after health rumours |date=17 March 2021 |work=BBC News}}</ref>

title: Samia Suluhu Hassan
deleted: In 2010, she sought election to the [[National Assembly (Tanzania)|National Assembly]], standing in the parliamentary constituency of [[Makunduchi]] and winning by more than 80%.<ref name=activisim>{{cite news|last1=Mwakyusa|first1=Alvar|title=Tanzania: Samia Suluhu Hassan â€“ a Tough Journey From Activism to Politics|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201409181187.html|access-date=16 November 2016|work=AllAfrica|date=18 September 2014|archive-date=5 August 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190805152926/https://allafrica.com/stories/201409181187.html|url-status=live}}</ref> President [[Jakaya Kikwete]] appointed her as the [[Minister of State for Union Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Tanzania: History Made as Samia Picked Running Mate|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201507130201.html|access-date=16 November 2016|work=AllAfrica|date=13 July 2015|archive-date=16 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161116101756/http://allafrica.com/stories/201507130201.html|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2014, she was elected as the Vice Chairperson of the Constituent Assembly tasked with drafting the country's new constitution.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Mwakyusa|first1=Alvar|title=Tanzania: Union 'Stalwart' Samia Is CA Vice-Chairperson|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201403140029.html|access-date=16 November 2016|work=AllAfrica|date=14 March 2014|archive-date=14 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140314153737/http://allafrica.com/stories/201403140029.html|url-status=live}}</ref>

In July 2015, CCM's [[Chama Cha Mapinduzi presidential primaries, 2015|presidential nominee]] [[John Magufuli]] chose her as his running mate for the [[2015 Tanzanian general election|2015 election]],<ref>{{Cite tweet |author=CCM |author-link=Chama Cha Mapinduzi |user=ccm_tanzania |number=620203847663783936 |date=12 July 2015 |title=''Mgombea mwenza Urais 2015 wa Mhe. John Pombe Magufuli ni..'' |retweet= |access-date=12 July 2015 |language=Swahili}}</ref> making her the first female running mate in the party's history.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://qz.com/451460/tanzanias-ruling-party-nominates-a-former-chemistry-teacher-as-its-candidate-for-president/ |title=Tanzania's ruling party nominates John Magufuli as presidential candidate |last1=Mohammed |first1=Omar |date=12 July 2015 |work=Quartz |access-date=12 August 2015 |archive-date=11 August 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811035232/http://qz.com/451460/tanzanias-ruling-party-nominates-a-former-chemistry-teacher-as-its-candidate-for-president/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 5 November 2015 she subsequently became the first female vice-president in the history of the country upon Magufuli's victory in the election.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/news/John-Magufuli-declared-Tanzania-s-fifth-president/-/2558/2934778/-/11h61lfz/-/index.html|title=CCM's John Magufuli declared Tanzania fifth president|work=The East African|last=Kalinaki|first=K. Daniel|date=30 October 2015|access-date=31 October 2015|archive-date=31 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151031002340/http://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/news/John-Magufuli-declared-Tanzania-s-fifth-president/-/2558/2934778/-/11h61lfz/-/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref> Both Magufuli and Suluhu were re-elected for a second five-year term on 28 October 2020.{{Citation needed|date=March 2021}}

On 17 March 2021, Suluhu announced that Magufuli had died after a long illness; Magufuli had not been seen in public since late February. She was sworn in as his successor on 19 March 2021, and will serve the balance of Magufuli's second five-year term.<ref name=CNN>{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/03/19/africa/tanzania-samia-suluhu-hassan-president-intl/|title=Tanzania swears in Samia Suluhu Hassan as first female president|first1=Ebby|last1=Shaban|first2=Bethlehem|last2=Feleke|work=CNN|date=19 March 2021}}</ref> The delay in the start of her term came because the Constitution of Tanzania explicitly requires the vice-<!-- usually hyphenated in the english version of the constitution -->president to take the presidential oath before ascending to the presidency;<ref name=Constitution>{{cite web |url=https://www.constituteproject.org/constitution/Tanzania_2005?lang=#399 |title=Constitution of Tanzania |quote=Where the office of President becomes vacant by reason of the death of the President, his resignation, loss of the electoral qualifications or inability to perform his functions due to physical infirmity, or failure to discharge the duties and functions of the office of President, then the Vice-President shall be sworn in and become the President for the unexpired period of the term of five years}}</ref> opposition leaders had expressed concern about a possible "vacuum" when 18 March passed without Suluhu being sworn in.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/19/tanzania-to-swear-in-new-president-on-friday-after-death-of-maguf|title=Tanzania swears in new president after sudden death of Magufuli|work=Al Jazeera|date=19 March 2021|access-date=21 March 2021}}</ref> Upon her swearing-in, Suluhu became Tanzania's first female president.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.businessdailyafrica.com/bd/news/east-africa/tanzania/tanzania-samia-suluhu-presidential-oath-3328214 |title=Tanzania's Samia Suluhu takes presidential oath |date=19 March 2021 |work=Business Daily}}</ref> She is also the first Zanzibari to hold the post,<ref name="thea_Tanz">{{Cite web |title=Tanzania: The legacy of Magufuli and the beginning for Suluhu |last=Kiruga |first=Morris |work=The Africa Report.com |date=18 March 2021 |access-date=19 March 2021 |url= https://www.theafricareport.com/73137/tanzania-the-legacy-of-magufuli-and-the-beginning-for-suluhu/}}</ref> and the third Muslim after [[Ali Hassan Mwinyi]] and [[Jakaya Kikwete]].<ref name="stan_Musl">{{Cite web |title=Muslim-Christianity ties that bind Suluhu's choice for deputy |last=Tongola |first=Mate |work=The Standard |date=19 March 2021 |access-date=19 March 2021 |url= https://www.standardmedia.co.ke/politics/article/2001406806/muslim-christianity-ties-that-bind-suluhus-choice-for-deputy}}</ref> She also became one of two serving female heads of state in Africa, alongside Ethiopia's [[Sahle-Work Zewde]].<ref name="econ_Tanz">{{Cite web |title=Tanzania's Samia Suluhu Hassan sworn in as first female president |agency=AFP |work=The Economic Times |date=19 March 2021 |access-date=19 March 2021 |url= https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/international/world-news/tanzanias-samia-suluhu-hassan-sworn-in-as-first-female-president/articleshow/81585379.cms?from=mdr}}</ref> Under the Constitution, since she took office with more than three years remaining in Magufuli's term, if she completes this term she will only be eligible for one full term in her own right should she decide to stand at the next election after serving out the full remainder of the term.<ref name=Constitution/>{{cfn|reason=Article 40(4) of the English version of the linked constitution appears to only impose that restriction for presidents who "occup[y] the office of President for three years or more" in accordance with the provisions of the article addressing presidential succession due to vacancy, meaning that it does not appear to prevent her from occupying the office for two full terms in her own right should she decide to resign or otherwise vacate the office before serving three years of her first term, assuming she does not end up serving three such years in total through, for example, a second succession due to vacancy.|date=March 2021}}
